label.phrase: just who's doing the hoarding food independence and real democracy

clusterList.phrase: just who's doing the hoarding food independence and real democracy

we face the grave convergence of expensive and scarce food in the midst of a world financial crisis of greater magnitude than that which shook the world in the decades of the thirties known as the great depression
hunger is the real issue and the crux of the issue is unemployment the need for good jobs

the faces of hunger will surprise you the new group of folks who are reaching out and in need look like you and i they go to church on sunday they pay taxes they have no obvious signs of poverty for the first time the images of hunger are starkly different than what they have ever been

the idea of the starving masses driven by their desperation to take to the streets and overthrow the ancien regime has seemed impossibly quaint since capitalism triumphed so decisively in the cold war and yet the headlines of the past month suggest that skyrocketing food prices are threatening the stability of a growing number of governments around the world when circumstances render it impossible to feed their hungry children normally passive citizens can very quickly become militants with nothing to lose
